title: R41839
content: The Dodd-Frank Act established the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) within the Federal Reserve System, consolidating regulatory authority in one regulator for consumer financial products and services. The CFP Act consolidates regulatory authority in the CFPB, giving it jurisdiction over various consumer financial products and services. It will serve as the primary federal supervisor for institutions offering these services and has the authority to prescribe regulations. The CFPB will oversee consumer financial products and services, including debt collection, real estate settlement, and money transmitting. It has authority to regulate existing consumer laws like TILA and RESPA to protect consumers. The CFPB will implement regulations for federal consumer laws like TILA and RESPA to protect consumers.
